title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Birmingham, AL)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and was contacted about two weeks later. Easy to schedule interview. Phone interview with one employee. Lasted less than thirty minutes. No overly difficult questions. Friendly, conversational interview
Interview Questions: Tell me what you know about Make-A-Wish (wanting a personalized answer)

title: Graphic Design Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Just one round of interview, very quick, standard questions (introducing yourself, experience, education), was asked to talked about a project but honestly it was nothing too in depth. The interviewer talked about the internship and what types of projects I would be working on.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: Biz Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Was an okay interview was an okay interview not much to it didn’t really take me for surprise answered things STAR format 2 interviews, a technical assessment and then an offer was made.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Public Relation Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview: Tell me about yourself, tell me about the company, why do you want to work for us? Very casual, competitive position, be prepared and list facts about the company
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself please

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The first call was with Human Resources and very brief. Then the next call was with hiring manager. It was a great conversation. It was very informative about the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview experience was online and simple. They looked at my experience, course projects, and overall goals/achievements that I would like to gain from the interview. We set the interview up through email and discussed expectations and job requirements.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: For Purdue we have to complete a 40 hour a week internship. I interviewed with a Sr. Wish Specialist and she was so kind. We shared how passionate we both were for this organization and what my position would look like. She asked me a few common motivational questions about why I wanted the position and how my experiences could help me with my internship there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Tel me about an experience and how it can help you with this position? Tell me about a weakness.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: I was an intern for the Madison, Wisconsin Affiliate of Make-A-Wish. I had a pretty easy phone screen that lasted about 20 minutes. Then I had one in-person interview with the two staff members at their office in downtown Madison. It lasted about 45 minutes to an hour. Both ladies were extremely pleasant and we got along great.
Interview Questions: Tell me about why you're interested in working for Make-A-Wish.

title: Senior Manager, Revenue Strategy & Prospect Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Application; hiring screen with the recruiter; two-person Zoom panel with two directors. After the panel interview, I was ghosted by both directors and the recruiter - no reply to follow-up was given nor any declination. Disappointed in the lack of respect shown by what I perceived to be a reputable organization.
Interview Questions: Standard 'walk me through your resume' stuff

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: in person interview with director of marketing. I was asked a series of questions and then asked whether i had questions about their mission or the role i was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Why i was interested in MAWOCIE.

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Memphis, TN) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: A messy process to get to the interview phase of the process. Including last minute communication. Questions were very personal and was asked "what is your history with the company" as if its expected for the job. It was clear i wasnt going to be selected for the position, instead will be given to a member of a sorority that provides funding for them as a philanthropy. No wonder the staff page looks the way it does.
Interview Questions: What is your history with this company? How do you deal with apologies? What would others say annoy them about you?

title: Financial Reporting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: This was one of the easiest interviews I've experienced. Of course, I was asked about my background and my accounting knowledge, but the hiring manager and other team members that interviewed me seemed more concerned with how I would fit into the organization and team culture.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Make-A-Wish?

title: Estagio Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions:
Perguntas legais, dinâmicas bem elaboradas bom ano de carreia ótimos benefícios como vale transporte vale alimentação gyspass cartão corporativo carro da empresa Day off
Não precisa usar uniforme nem crachá
Interview Questions:
O que vc faz?
O que vc há fez?
Qual animal você seria?
Qual cor favorita?
Última comida?

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was extremely nice. Seems like a great work environment. I would have loved to work here. I never received feedback or anything about if I got the job or not. Would not apply again.
Interview Questions: They asked several behavioral questions

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I had two different interviews, one with an HR Manager and the other with the team I would work on. Both were fairly straight forward and asked basic interview questions!
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in non-profit work/working at Make a Wish?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview was appropriately thorough and covered interpersonal and soft skills, as well as practical skills. There was a definite interest in ability to deal with and related to families and external stakeholders.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for Make A Wish?

title: Philanthropy Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Had a 30-minute screening call. The interview itself was in person. Everyone was quite inviting and nice. They wanted to know about my experience and really wanted to have a conversation.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Make-A-Wish? Name a time when you made a mistake.

title: Alumni Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Scottsdale, AZ) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very pleasant, professional, and well-conducted! Both my interviewers were nice and gave a very welcoming presence, free of pressure or judgment. It lasted about 30 mins or so and they both were very knowledgable about the company and mission.
Interview Questions: How have you worked in teams with children or worked with little kids in past job experiences?

title: Bénévole Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions:
Processus un peu long sur la durée mais très complet.

Plusieurs appels avec le RH, une réunion d'information, un entretien physique avec le RH et un salarié du pôle vœux et une formation d'engagement
Interview Questions: Pourquoi souhaitez vous rejoindre notre association

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone screen with HR & 2nd video interview with Make a Wish team.  Both had standard interview questions and felt conversational. After the 2nd interview, I received a call the following week with an offer.
Interview Questions: How do you expect to handle the delicate/sensitive nature of this work?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great and everyone was very kind. I heard back quickly when I originally applied. There were 3 other team members interviewing me, they all asked basic questions.
Interview Questions:
Are you comfortable with your writing skills
And why would you like to work for MAW

title: Donor Communications and Stewardship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The process involved 1 brief phone interview with a member of the HR team a few weeks after applying, and a second in-person interview with the reporting manager. Both interviews were vey comfortable. I was offered the internship about a week after the second interview.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to intern with Make-A-Wish? 
What are your career goals?
What do you hope to learn from this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I went through a phone interview, in person interview, and a project completion portion. I appreciated the variety this offered as I got to talk to several individuals throughout the organization.
Interview Questions: Most questions were geared towards explaining my previous experience and elaborating on how that prepared me to take on the intern position I was applying for.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Washington, DC) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of three rounds where I talked to different members of the Program Team. For the last interview, I spoke with the VP of Mission Delivery and had to answer a prompt.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Make-A-Wish?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: 2 part interview. First part was by phone and second in-person. First part was your basic interview questions and second was more of a discussion about what the job requires and how you fit in.
Interview Questions: 1. What did you find on our website that was interesting?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: A very thoughtful and well constructed interview process, had a circumstance where I couldn't make it into the office and they were extremely accommodating at let me do it virtually instead of in person
Interview Questions: What skills do you have that will help you to excel in this role?

title: National Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: only accepted internal referrals and never contacted. it was very discouraging to spend all that time to apply to only have internal applicants interviewed.  Very poor practice. g g g g g g g g g g g g g
Interview Questions: none. only took internal applicants

title: Marketing Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Dublin, Dublin) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an video interview by an external recruiter. I was disappointed by the bad attitude of the hiring manager during the interview and felt it influenced the outcome of the interview. I believe candidates should be treated appropriately for the opportunity they are interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for the role?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and they asked me about my work history and skills. They wanted me to come in for an in-person interview but I decided not to because they would not budge on salary and it was too low for me.
Interview Questions: What do you do in your current role?

title: Chief Executive Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: It was incredibly laborious. It included multiple questionnaires asking redundant information . I met with the recruiter, the head of the search committee, and the local board of directors. The process took about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: What makes you uniquely qualified to be the CEO?

title: Wish Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was enjoyable. It began with a phone call interview. Then it was followed up a week later with two different managers. Everyone I engaged with was super friendly and enthusiastic about the role. I felt confident about the whole process but never even got a follow up. The last I heard from them was that position details were still being finalized and it’s been over two months now.
Interview Questions: Ability to handle sensitive work situations.

title: Developmental Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Application with cover letter and resume--> took a bit to get interview offer 
30 minute behavioral and informational phone call--> lots of room to ask questions  
30 minute behavioral with two employers--> typical behavioral questions
Interview Questions: Why Make-A-Wish? Have you had experience in non-profit work before?

title: Wish Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Memphis, TN) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview process! They asked lots of  questions and ended up having 2 interviews before they made a decision. I ultimately ended up not getting the job but I would really recommend working there!
Interview Questions: What are some short and long term goals?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Raleigh, NC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Met with the hiring manager and had a great interview.  But then never heard another word.  No follow up or even a rejection.   I kept checking the website and the status was never updated.  I realize it is a nonprofit but common courtesy in responding to candidates should be a non negotiable
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for Make A Wish

title: Communications and Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Seattle, WA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very easy! Phone call with team lead - super communication based. Heard back pretty quickly after that I got the job.  Incredibly caring and empathetic team. Only downside is you do not get paid for this role.
Interview Questions:
- Why Make A Wish 
- Tell us about yourself

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: After applying in the spring I heard back about a month and a half later asking to set up an interview. The interview process was normal and I heard back about 3 weeks later and was extended the position.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Make-A-Wish and what experiences have you had with the organization in the past?

title: Software Engineer(Internship) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I came into the office for a quick conversation with the staff who would’ve been in charge of the interns. After the interview I was given a short tour of the office space.
Interview Questions: What interests you about the position?

title: Corporate Relations Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Bethesda, MD) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple enough which consisted of one on one conversations with the hiring manager and CEO. One thing I found odd was their was no direct HR contact which to me is never a good sign during the interview process.
Interview Questions: Typical questions about background and prior work experience. Got the impression this was a more sales “cold calling” job then my direct fundraising experience would be necessary for.

title: Executive Asistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: First interview was great and they rushed to schedule a second asap. Then the day came for the second interview and they completely flaked...literally 15 minutes before. Rude. Good to know before accidentally working for them that they don't value people's time.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I would accept a certain salary pretty quickly.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Honolulu, HI) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and very encouraging to anyone and everyone interviewing for internships, they will make you feel so encouraged and help you gain experience for the interview process
Interview Questions: What can you specifically bring to our company?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at Make a Wish was very organized and professional. Phone and video interviews. The process was relatively short. HR screening call, phone interview, hiring manager interview, local board interview, panel interview
Interview Questions: What qualifies you to be the next CEO?  (paraphrase)

title: Marketing and Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the Idaho Branch. Interviewed with CEO. She was responsive and prompt. Once I applied, I had an interview a couple days later. Was offered a second interview but I decided to pursue another opportunity.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current job responsibilities.

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I enjoyed everyone I met with! It was an interesting experience doing it virtually and I met with a lot of people but it is not a surprise for the nature of the role.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Make-A-Wish?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed environment. Everyone was trying to get to know me and wanted to know my career plans. Nothing scary at all. I was asked a few questions but nothing hard. Everything was about my life only.
Interview Questions:
What do you like about Maw? 
What do you want to get out of the job?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Had two different interviews. One was over the phone with HR and the other with my potential supervisors over zoom. Both were very pleasant and pretty laid back. Asked typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?/Why do you want to work in non-profit?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (London, England) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multiple-stage process for hiring new employees. The stages mainly comprise job interviews held either one-on-one, with a group of candidates, or with a panel. Interviews are co
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in a few years time

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview was laidback and went by quickly. It was via the phone. I received an offer a few days later and accepted. The person who interviewed and hired me left the organization before I began my internship.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you know about Make-A-Wish (looking for a personal connection to the organization)

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: There was an unscheduled phone screening to put you on the spot, so be prepared by knowing the mission and values. Followed up by 2 official virtual interviews with your direct supervisor and the intern coordinator
Interview Questions: What do you know about Make-A-Wish?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview is not too difficult and is mostly behavioral. The interviewers seem to care about you and what you've done. You should have good stories to tell and really try to show your qualities.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Program Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Lots of questions, but a very smooth. process. Be prepared to answer a good amount of questions and make sure to go over their website. Be knowledgable about their organization
Interview Questions: What was your favorite wish story you read about?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: You first applied online by sending an email and filling out a form. There are time slots in which you are able to apply. Then there's a phone call interview with the general internship coordinator, then a Skype interview with the director.
Interview Questions: What are you interested about in Make A Wish?

title: Corporate Alliances Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick to hear back from job posting submission. Interview began with clear guidance on salary and location for work to be done and asked if that was OK and I wanted to proceed. Interview was pleasant, pride in employer representative for the work they do as part of Make A Wish. Fairly quick to hear back with a decision.
Interview Questions: Compensation is X, and the work base location is Y. Do you understand and care to move ahead with your candidacy interview.

title: Development Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial screening interview where you get asked which intern position (marketing and communications, development, community engagement, or program services) you are most interested in. The notes from the screening interview then get passed along to the directors of each program and they email you to schedule a second interview if they are interested. The second round interview repeats some of the initial questions and asks additional questions specific to the role. Unfortunately, the internships were canceled due to Covid-19 before I heard back.
Interview Questions:
Why Make-A-Wish?
Do you have experience with event planning?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great! Friendly people. We talked a lot about the mission of the organization—all are very passionate about the work they do. Made me feel very comfortable in the interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The Director of Development asked me to come to the Greensboro office to interview for the position. We discussed my qualifications and moved forward from there, then they offered me a position as an intern.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Blue Bell, PA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to talk about my interest in their work and my qualifications for the role.  My interviewer was very kind and seemed genuinely interested in who I was and my career aspirations.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here?

title: Wish Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Monroe, NJ) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was seamless, professional and friendly. Although I didn’t get the job, I could tell that the work environment would be positive, based on my interview experience. I especially enjoyed the time spent discussing hypothetical wishes, as it gave me an insight to what the job would be like day to day.
Interview Questions: How would you help a wish family who were stuck at a train station in a foreign country without tickets, and they’re calling you to fix it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Webcam interview conducted in a group setting. It is very relaxing and the recruiter really cares for you. They made me very comfortable by asking fun questions instead of  all intense ones.
Interview Questions: Strengths?

title: Digital Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 2+ weeks. I interviewed in Phoenix, Arizona. I applied online through their website through a referral. There was an initial phone interview about my education and experience and then a follow up in-person interview with more behavioral questions. Everyone was very nice and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you worked well in a team

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was over the phone and then I was asked back for an in-person interview with employees. Questions were your average interview questions and I got the internship. Unfortunately, due to the corona pandemic my opportunity was postponed indefinitely.
Interview Questions: What is one interesting thing you found on our website?

title: Wish Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen shortly after submitting online application, in-person interview with two team members at the office 1.5 weeks later. Communication was consistent and helpful until I  interviewed the second time; at that point they didn't communicate until I reached out and asked if they had made a decision.
Interview Questions: What about this position intrigues you?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. A month and a half later I get an email asking for me to come in for an interview. In the interview I sat down with my bosses and received a small tour of the office. Two weeks after the interview I received a call with an offer for the position and an official offer letter via email.
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose to apply to Make-A-Wish for this position?
What do you know about our organization?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Denver, CO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very informative interview process.  2 people interviewing a group of volunteer candidates.  Described mission very well and very engaging.  Had Q&A at end for everybody.  Described various opportunities.  Explained timing.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself to the team here.

title: Accounting Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Intensive and thorough. Was interviewed by several people who were pleasant, however, when the senior manager came in to interview me, I felt judged by senior manager the minute she walked in the room. She was not gracious and I as not made to feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: What I knew about the company

title: Business Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through my school, then went in for an interview. The interview was short, but I was offered this position about 5 minutes after the formal interview.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you experienced hardships

title: Manager of Corporate Partnerships Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Orlando, FL) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then an in-person interview with the Director of Development, followed by a series of interviews of three people in the office (one being the CEO) on a different date.
Interview Questions: If you had to "make a wish" and you weren't allowed to gift the wish or ask for more wishes, what would you wish for?

title: Wish Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Sacramento, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a friendly phone interview that wanted to get to know more about you and your abilities. I liked that they are friendly and were curious to understand you skills as well as your struggles. I had a great interview with them and hope other do as well.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit my resume and cover letter to the management level. They called to schedule an interview. The interview presented very general/typical questions for this kind of role. I had to submit the contact information for my recommendations.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the Make-A-Wish Foundation?

title: Wish Relations Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: In person interview, follow up with Vice- President. Lack of communication after interview. Interviewer was great and very personable, but did not respond to email for 3 weeks after.
Interview Questions: What does a Wish mean to you?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Went into the Orange County office and had a rather surface-level, impersonal interview. After the initial 1:1, I had a phone call with the department I was interested in. They passed me onto another department without saying anything, and the other department cold called me in the middle of the day because they felt it “might be a good time.” The process felt rushed and had minimal structure.
Interview Questions: Recall a time when you were faced with a problem that didn’t have a clear solution. How did you handle it?

title: Assessment Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (New York, NY) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The communication was consistent and their HR is very kind and clear.  The interview process was great and I felt comfortable throughout.  The questions were based on my own previous experience and she was very honest on the difficulty of the position.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult conversations?

title: Communications and Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Seattle, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: One over the phone interview and one in person interview. Both very quick and simple. No more than 30 minutes. Interviewer was very nice and asked questions mostly about my interests and personality.
Interview Questions: What a three words to describe your personality?

title: Donor Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Tempe, AZ) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. Called in for a in person 30 minutes interview then back for another to meet with some of the higher ups on the team and then again to talk with the other folks in the department. All in all 3 interviews. All in person. They were very accommodating and easy going asking me about my background and why MAW.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work for Make A Wish

title: Graphic Designer Interview

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Las Vegas, NV) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I completed the very lengthy application on their website, and was contacted via an email a few days later. The email linked me to an automatic appointment scheduler which definitely led me to believe they were bringing quite a few people in.

Their office is very open and bright. As I learned in the interview, they are located on / next to the Allegiant Airlines corporate property, who gifted them the space for free.

I was interviewed by the head of the Las Vegas office, who was very pleasant. The interview itself felt pretty basic and standard, but she was very enthusiastic to answer all of my questions about the company and its mission. At the conclusion of the interview, she mentioned that over 150 people applied for the position, and she'd let me know by the following week. Her saying that to me immediately made me feel like I wasn't going to get it. I got a rejection email a few days later.

It seems like a great place to work, so I was definitely bummed that I didn't get it.  Maybe this is just stating the obvious....but I guess my only advice to those who apply in the future would be to really over-prepare yourself and step up your game for the interview as it is extremely competitive.
Interview Questions: Describe a problem in the workplace that you had to overcome.

title: Operations Interview

We discussed quite a bit my experience and career goals. Afterwards I asked if I would hear back either way and was given a yes. It has been two weeks since and I have not heard back since even after a follow up email.

title: Grants Manager Interview

Was called for final interview and met with 3 different directors and was told after another 3 weeks, they were revamping the position and starting over. So 9 weeks of wasted time.
Interview Questions: How do you deal working under pressure?

title: Wish Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online for a Wish Coordinator role. Pretty soon after, I was notified to schedule a phone interview. Soon after, I had two separate interviews: the first with two wish managers and the second with two program Directors. I really liked the organization and the whole team. Very nice and friendly interview process which focused on the passion behind the mission.  I got a very positive impression from everyone I interviewed with and the fact that I was called back for a second interview so quickly also seemed to show their interest in me.

 Unfortunately, I did not hear anything back from them for two weeks until someone from HR responded to an email I had sent following up saying they had some refinancing going on and would update me soon about final decisions. I never heard back despite following up with them a bit later. Seems like a great place to work, but they need to respect an individual's time during the interview process. Not giving an individual an update after bringing them into the office twice and then not responding to any emails is disrespectful and unprofessional. Looking at other reviews on Glassdoor, this appears to be a pattern with not getting back to individuals.
Interview Questions: How would you proceed if you learned that a wish could not be completed?

title: Analyst Interview

The recruiter left a message.  I called the recruiter back later that same day and left a message.  I tried the recruiter a few more times throughout the next few days and ultimately left another message.  Yeah, never heard back.  No email, either.  What, exactly, was the point of calling me in the first place?!  It's alright, because in that time, I received an offer from a company I actually really dig.  Oh well.
Interview Questions: If only I actually had an interview, I'd be able to provide a few example questions!

Next was an in person interview that delved deeper into my previous experience in the field. There was a good mix of standard interview questions as well as unique situational questions. Finally, I was sent an assignment which included 3 questions. The questions judged my organizational, time management and communications skills.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I had applied for a Media & Communications internship with the Mid-Atlantic region. After submitting my resume, I heard back almost immediately and was asked for a phone interview within that week. 

The woman I was interviewed by seemed very young and immature- she stated that she had started with the company a few months back. She fumbled through a lot of questions, giggled frequently, kept apologizing, and had difficulty coming up with questions to ask. Upon every response I gave her she kept going "yaaahhhh, thats great! Ok so um....." - it all seemed quite unprofessional. She also kept saying "like" a lot in between her words. 

I don't mind - and can appreciate - informal interviews and conduct, but this interview made me feel like I might have been more qualified than her.  It was all very strange. However, I had felt that despite the rather lax interview that I did well with my responses to all of her questions.

As the phone interview ended, she told me that she would get back to me within the week with any updates, and I have not heard anything back in the month+ since. 

I did however, find out from a mutual friend who works in the office that one of the intern positions was offered and filled 4 days after my interview- maybe that is why I have not heard anything, as they had filled the role. But I would have expected some follow-up or a reply back since the foundation expressed a real, positive interest for me. 

This was all quite a bizarre experience and one I wouldn't have expected from a well established and highly regarded foundation.
Interview Questions: Why are you passionate about Make-A-Wish?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Honolulu, HI) in Sept 2016

The CEO seems disorganized, stressed, a bit rude and judgemental, and seems to size you up the minute you see her. She also bursts into weird fits of laughter during the interview and didn't hide the fact that she's barely interested in what you have to say and cut you off while you're talking. 

I immediately got an impression and since I'm not a white, middle-aged woman like her, there's little chance of her hiring me. And I was right. I can bet 100% that they hired a white person. Discrimination is apparently very cool at this company.
Interview Questions: What is my biggest accomplishment? What is the low point of your job and how did you handle it?

Interview Questions: "Tell me about yourself"

title: Alliance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online -- heard back rather quickly, was able to get three phone interviews within 2 weeks -- then they went silent for a week -- finally, scheduled a 4th phone interview. Then they went dark again for another 2 or 2.5 weeks, so I thought I wasn't going further in the process. Out of no where, I was called for an in-person interview -- I was excited because I thought I didn't get the role since they hadn't communicated with me in two weeks. They flew me out there and back the same day for the in-person; they also told me they would reimburse my expenses i.e. taxi and food. I was told in the office that I would be notified within the next week or two, either way -- whether I was hired or not. I followed up two weeks later because I didn't hear anything, neither yay or nay, about my in-person interview; and I also needed to submit my expense receipts. In this follow up, I emailed my expense receipts and was told they couldn't take them by email, I needed to send the originals in the mail --- which I don't understand why a copy would not suffice -- for example, the Uber receipt was via email, so this really didn't make sense. Well, I followed up and was told they were still making their decision and they were sorry for the wait and asked me to just sit tight for them and they would be getting back to me. Well... two more weeks passed, nothing. It's not been 1.5 months since my in-person interview and CLEARLY I did not get the role, which is fine, but to this day, I have not been notified one way or the other. They made it seem like my in-person interview was just a formality to meet the team, as if I was already hired because I had already interviewed with everyone on the phone (minus the CEO, I met him in person only). I left my job, hired a realtor to help with relocating, since it was explained as just coming to meet the team -- but I heard nothing about whether or not I was hired -- not a pin drop. I appreciate what this organization has done over the years for children, but I would never ever work with them due to how unprofessional this experience was. Not to mention, I was told in the interview that they don't really hire from within, so my development and growth would be up to me. If you say you are going to let a candidate know either way, then actually do that -- especially a candidate that has reached the final interview stage and was flown out.

***Update: Hmmm... funny thing, the day after I write this review, which is MORE THAN 1.5 MONTHS AFTER MY IN-PERSON where I was told I would get a phone call within 1-2 weeks max, regardless of the outcome ---- I guess they check their Glassdoor regularly lol because now, one day after writing this review, they sent me an automated letter stating the went with a different candidate. Oh please, now I have zero respect for this organization. I definitely dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions: What do you do if your client wants more than their budget will allow for?
