title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position online and was contacted about 3weeks later for a phone screening.  About 2 weeks after the phone screening I was asked to go through a virtual interview for the position, since I was in another state.  I meet with to members of Make-a-wish's HR department who interview me for the position.
Interview Questions:
Why make-a-wish?
What do you know about HR?
Are you interviewing for any other Internships?

title: Bilingual Wish Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Boston, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: They send me a email for scheduled the interview. On the day of the interview they call me on time, the chat was very nice, the interviewer ask me typical questions about my resume, my experience, my expectations, salary and benefits. Although this was for a bilingual position the woman dint speak in spanish at all.
Interview Questions: what salary do you expect?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Tampa, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: phone interview then in person interview. each around 40 minutes, focused around your interest in the mission and the purpose of the organization to see if you would be a good fit for the environment
Interview Questions: What do you know about Make a Wish?

title: Marketing & Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied after seeing a job posting on LinkedIn for an internship at the Georgia location. Within two weeks, I received in email to set up a time for a phone interview. The interviewer was friendly and patient, and the questions were mostly behavioral, nothing too difficult. It did help to do research on the company since the first question they asked me was what I knew about MAW and the mission statement. 
A few days later, I received in email to set up a time for a video interview (would have been face to face, but I did not live in Georgia). I was interviewed by the manager of the marketing department, and he was also very friendly. Again, the questions weren't too difficult. 

The following week, I received an email offering me the position.
Interview Questions: What is MAW's mission statement?

title: Event Planning Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied via an online job board. Sent a resume and cover letter to the person of contact. I received a phone call about a week later.  After the brief 10 minute phone interview I was told they would contact me the following week to schedule a personal interview.  

I was contacted and scheduled the personal interview for the following week.  I interviewed with two individuals who work in and around event planning for the Make-A-Wish Foundation
After the interview I sent thank you/follow up emails to the two individuals who interviewed me.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the Make-A-Wish Foundation?

title: Volunteer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a scheduled video call with two make a wish employees. It was quick and enjoyable. Went straight through the company. No Human Resources at this point. It was good.
Interview Questions: What are my future goals?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was offered a phone interview, the phone call lasted about 15 minutes. I interviewed with two employees with the MWF. Very painless interview. They were such a pleasure to talk to.The questions they asked me were not your average questions but very unique, giving you the opportunity to show case your personality and creativity.
Interview Questions:
Describe an experience in which you went over and beyond on a task?
What do you look for in a manager?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I saw the spring Intern posting online and applied via e-mail, the process took 1 day then I recevied a call to confoirm the interview. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
What do you know about the organization work?
what was your role in a project team?
What is your experience?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: 2 Phone followed by 4 individual personal interviews.  I traveled 4 hours, and stayed overnight at their request, was not offered any reimbursement. They told recruiter they were expecting someone younger of a different appearance.  I am a middle-age professional, with professional appearance.
Interview Questions: Same questions asked by all four interviewers each time.

title: Special Events Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Made me feel comfortable and described the position and hours. Willing to work with school schedule and described expectations. We talked for about 20 mins and then they offered me the position for start whenever was best for me. Very easy and a good time to get to know who you would be answering to as an intern.
Interview Questions: How will you university courses benefit your work for this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Bethesda, MD) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple and straight forward, asked conventional interview questions. Lasted about 20 minutes with the Department head who did not end up being my direct supervisor. She was friendly but seemed in a rush.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself, how does your experience match with our mission/goals

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Four-person panel.  They asked a series of questions related to office work and internship experience.  After the panel interview, there is an Excel test.  The panel was engaged and asked good questions.  Be prepared to tell about yourself and your experiences.
Interview Questions: What type of intern experience do you have?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was great. I interned at the Make-A-Wish Chapter in Sacramento for 4 months. Sarah (Marketing Coordinator) and Nichoel) interviewed me, asking me about myself, what would I like to learn, do I have experience with web...etc. very low key, and afterwards, Nichoel gave me a tour of the building and the wishing well.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What is your availability?
Are you familiar with web and graphics?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really easy going!  The office was nice and made me feel super comfortable. Everyone was friendly and I really enjoyed talking to all the employees.  I spoke one on one with an employee and then accepted the position.
Interview Questions: What interested you in non profits?

title: Wish Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: I emailed in my cover letter and resume about two weeks before the deadline. I received an email first asking for a phone-interview and then received an email that looked like an automated email saying they received all of my information and would contact me at a later time if they wished to move forward (this was very confusing). When I did have my initial interview, they lady interviewing me called me about 15 minutes late. The questions we very basic and it sounded like she was reading them off of a questionnaire she found online. For such a unique position, I was shocked how generic the questions were.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with databases?

title: Human Resources/Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Columbus, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and inviting.  The atmosphere was casual and relaxed.  It was just a one on one interview, with the manager I was working under.  Mostly talking about the role and what responsibilities I would have and how my past experience would relate to that new role.  I really enjoyed the process and the whole thing was straightforward and easy.  The only bad thing was that it took awhile for them to get back to me about the job.
Interview Questions: How past roles you have had, relate to new role your are applying for?

title: PR Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Syracuse, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: She asked me about my school work, why I could see myself there, where I could see myself in the future. It was very laid back, she was more interested in my life and experiences and getting to know me than anything else.
Interview Questions: How do you think you could better our operation?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Staff is generally friendly and ask questions about your passion rather than experience. This could be because the do a wonderful job of stewarding their intern and helping them develop skills through mentorship.
Interview Questions: What motivators you to work with children.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Austin, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online after I had met a recruiter at a career fair. I was then called in for an in person interview. It was two of them and I, very casual.
Interview Questions:
Why did I want this position?
Why Make-A-Wish?

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Sacramento, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met the volunteer manager at a career fair, submitted an application and then emailed her. I was then called in for an interview at the foundation site. It was with the marketing manager and volunteer manager. It was brief -- my talents, hobbies, what I would like to learn, etc.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Wish Granter Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Honolulu, HI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview provess was very easy and also very informational. They asked me what my goal was for the prganization and i explained to them that i wanted to help kids who are going through the worst time of their lives
Interview Questions: What is your goal for the make a wish foundation

title: Community Events Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied on school website, heard back in a few weeks from hiring manager, had a phone interview, and interviewed at Make-A-Wish Georgia with the my supervisor. It was very laid back and easy.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a fundraising event you would create.

title: Human Resources Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed first by phone then brought in for an in person interview with the manager.  My next interview was five hours long.  There was no need for the interview to be this lengthy.  I met with six different groups of two to three people.  Each interview lasted about 20 to 30 minutes.  I was also asked to produce a writing sample which I was given during the time I was supposed to have lunch.  During lunch, when I was writing the sample the Human Resources department went out to lunch to celebrate on of the teams upcoming wedding.  It wasn't a good day for them to conduct interviews because they were not focused at all.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question I was asked was how to find candidates which is a typical question for a recruiting position.  The questions were not very difficult.

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I have applied through job search site and got email to schedule a phone interview interview. It wasn't hard. All questions are behavioral questions. Should know about the company's background and also try to express your interest in working with a NGO.
Interview Questions: It wasn't hard. All questions are behavioral questions.

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very casual and relaxed - they want to know about you and why you want to work for a non profit. They will ask questions to ensure that you are fit for the job, but it is nothing different from most interviews
Interview Questions: What do you know about Make-A-Wish?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I really enjoyed the interview process. It gave me an opportunity to see what the space was like and meet my potential co-workers. The interview was organized with reasonable questions. The interviewer made me feel extremely comfortable. The questions really spoke to their mission to grants the wish of a child diagnosed with a life-threatening medical condition in the United States and its territories, on average, every 38 minutes
Interview Questions: What would you wish be?

title: Special Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview.  Interviewer was very friendly, and the call was laid back.  Questions were very standard. The call as 45 minutes total, and the interviewer was very upfront about how many other candidates were selected.
Interview Questions: If you could only tell me one thing about yourself, what would you want me to know?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Initial communications were great with the hiring manager.  Went in for an interview for an internship and really learned a lot about the company and position.  Very amicable employees, good experience.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question asked was how do i think i could stimulate more foundation donations

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter maintained the application and correspondence process; however, the potential supervisors for each department were conducting the interviews. The interview was casual and very sincere; however, the questions were difficult--in a good way. One of the best interviews I've experienced.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions, how previous coworkers viewed you, your knowledge of the organization, level of flexibility and problem solving

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Maitland, FL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process starts with a phone interview and then you are asked to join them for an in-person interview. I was interviewed by the entire development team (4 women), which was just a tad bit intimidating. Overall, the questions were basic interview questions such as what are your strong skills, what are your weak ones, what do you know about Make-A-Wish, etc.
Interview Questions: What do you know about The Make-A-Wish Foundation?

title: Wish Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Columbus, OH) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was called by phone to schedule interview that week, was interviewed by two wish program managers, very easy-going and conversational interview, only lasted roughly 20 minutes, heard back from them 3 day later that I was accepted
Interview Questions: Why I want to work for make a wish

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions:
I saw the Summer Intern posting online and applied via e-mail. About a month later, I was contacted by MAW staff and asked to come in for an interview with the Communications team. Maybe two weeks after the interview took place, I was contacted by a different set of MAW staff members asking me to come in and interview for the Intern position with the Wish Team. I was unable to come in person for this one (because I had returned to school post-break) so we carried out the interview via Skype.

I received a final verdict from the Wish Team shortly after - I had received the position! I never ended up hearing back from the Communications team, which I thought was odd at the time, but hey, everything works out for a reason I guess!
Interview Questions: What do you know about us as an organization?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Lake Success, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I happened to meet the CFO by chance at an unrelated event. I had an interview with him that went exceptionally well. I was called back for a second interview to meet with the accounting coordinator, head of wish granting, and COO. The COO was uninviting, insulting, and incredibly rude. She turned my interview into a 20 minute lecture about Make-A-Wish's mission is the most important thing because I mentioned something about how the job could further my own career. It sounded like I was interviewing for a cult.
Interview Questions: No questions were out of the ordinary. I was asked what I know about Make-A-Wish, why I chose a career in accounting, etc.

title: Program Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call the day after I applied and we set up a Skype interview.  Interview went really smoothly.  Didn't ask really any behavioral questions, it was more conversation based and they were very detailed on the job description.  They sounded really positive and reacted well to all of my answers.
Interview Questions: Tell us about an interesting course you took in college or high school

title: Data Entry & Gift Processing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied online through email. After about a week, I received a phone call to schedule a phone interview. After the phone interview, I was then asked to come in for an in person interview. The person interviewing was very nice. The interview went well and I was asked typical behavioral questions and specifics towards the actual job. She was very informative and kept me up to date with the whole process. Overall was a great experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director of Volunteers Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Lake Success, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews with various staff members- I believe 6 total. The team gave plenty of time for questions, and a great understanding of the organization and their goals. They seemed to have a good benefits plan but compensation was on the low end.
Interview Questions: What would your goals be within your first 6 months working here?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (El Paso, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Formal interview in the office.  However, the Development Director was very nice and welcoming throughout the entire process.  She began asking about my previous knowledge on Make-A-Wish Foundation.  Then, she proceeded to ask me questions about my educational and previous work experience.  Finally, she gave me an opportunity to ask my own questions.
Interview Questions: What can you tell me about the Make-A-Wish Foundation?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Columbus, OH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The person viewed other candidates then call me for interview. She asked me questions get to know me and look at my portfolio. She seemed like she like my art, gave good comments.
Interview Questions: What projects you like more.

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for the marketing internship at make a wish, phoenix. Got an email within a week to schedule a phone interview. Pretty standard questions. Got to schedule an in person interview right after the phone interview. The in person interview was very conversational. Seems to be a great work environment. Still waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you found very challenging

title: Wish Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was sent an email with supplemental questions. Then I got an interview at the office
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my resume and cover letter. Then I was contacted by the Volunteer Coordinator. She mentioned specific skills that I had that they were interested in via her email. I interviewed with her over the phone twice. The first time was just some basic background and was short. The second was more about my interest in the position and my experience. Finally I talked with my would-be supervisor (Communications Director). She gave more in-depth questions that seemed to be looking to see if I was a good fit overall with her and the position and the office. Then I was told I received the job.
Interview Questions: Why did I apply for the job?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. It was like talking to a friend. I interviewed on the phone and then came to the office for a second interview. I received my first interview call two days after I applied and ended up taking a different position than I had applied for.
Interview Questions: If you could have a wish granted, what would it be and why?

title: Chapter Reporting and Analysis Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied through my school career website. I was contacted a couple weeks later for a phone interview which led to two back-to-back Skype interviews. The phone interview was about 20 minutes and each Skype interview was about 20 minutes long. I was then contacted over the phone about a week later saying that I got the job.
Interview Questions: Talk more about this specific experience from your resume. What motivates you everyday? What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?

title: Marketing/Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: very casual, I emailed the executive director and we scheduled an interview.  He just asked me basic questions like what I want to get out of the internship, etc.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for make-a-wish?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and a few weeks later received an e-mail from a Development Associate asking me to come in for an interview. When I arrived for the interview I was greeted by 2 Development Associates who then brought me into the board room for the interview. From the start I felt welcomed and comfortable in the environment. The interview was only supposed to last 30 min but it lasted an hour because we got caught up in conversations. It was very easy to talk, and I never felt uncomfortable or under pressure. Overall it was a great experience
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our organization?

title: Wish Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my required documents via email. A few days later, I was emailed back asking when I could go in to the office to talk more about the position. The interview did not feel like an interview, in a good way. The interviewer gave excellent feedback, seemed extremely interested in what I had to say, and made me feel comfortable. It was just like having a conversation with someone. 

I was told that I would have to wait a few weeks for their final say. However, the interviewer did tell me to feel free to email them asking if I was still being considered for the position and I would be given an honest answer. I'm am currently still waiting but the site insisted that I give an answer to their "did you get an offer" question. 

 Overall, I had a very positive interview experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you experienced a conflict and how you handled it.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: phone interview then 2nd interview then got hired after 2nd interview. First interview was with 1 person, 2nd interview was with 2 people. One worked behind the scenes in the company, the other hands on with the families and the make a wish child. It was very laid back and each of the interviewees switched off asking generic interview questions
Interview Questions: What is your life motto

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America
Interview Descriptions: Interview was only with one person. She asked me basic questions. The hardest question was asking me if I would be able to complete tasks on a timely manner and if I thought it would be better to just volunteer.
Interview Questions: What was your most recent challenge?

title: Special Events Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Miami, FL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a very general interview. They asked me about the previous experience I had based off my resume. I met with the university liaison and the Dirctor of the Resources team. During the interview they gave me more information about the chapter and the overall mission of the organization. They also gave me information on the next steps within the application process.  I worked with the Resource department during the summer.
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have that applies to this internship?

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview with the Director of Business Development followed by an in-office interview. The questions were very straight forward and expected for the position. A week later I came in for an in-person interview where I was offered the position after a brief 10 minute conversation. A lot of it came down to personality and whether the director and I had a strong connection and similar personality traits-outgoing, passionate, eager and interested in the community.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Make-a-Wish? What are you strengths and weaknesses? What do you want to do with your future (in regard to your career)? What do you know about the foundation and our mission?  thoroughly researched the company and position to prepare for the interview which was fairly easy overall.

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: This is for the Ohio, Kentucky & Indiana Chapter. the process was long and hard. Several rounds were required because I later found out they had such culture fit problems.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to support the mission.

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic. All three member just ask a lot of low key question. Why us? Explaining their group and the stories and live they touch. What they do here. What I would be doing. How much i would be paid. How many hours I'll be commenting.
Interview Questions: Why choose to intern with MAW?

title: Marketing Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Minneapolis, MN) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview with your future supervisor where she asks why you'd like to work at Make-A-Wish and what you'd like to get out of the internship. Then you briefly cover some of your past projects that qualify you for this position.
Interview Questions: What do you want to get out of this internship?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Simple; submitted my resume and had a phone interview. Then, I followed up with my interviewer and sent writing samples. After receiving my writing samples, Make-A-Wish reached back out with a fall internship offer.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to intern for Make-A-Wish?

title: Finance and Accounting Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied through my University's job search portal (resume and cover letter) and received an email requesting a phone interview within a few hours of applying. We scheduled the phone interview for the following week- behavior questions but also general get to know you questions. At the end of the phone interview, I was invited to come to their office in Atlanta for an in-person interview. The in person interview was brief and behavioral. I did not receive an offer until 8 weeks later via email.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about a job or volunteer experience that you would never do again"

title: Fundraising Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The panel consisted of three people. One person seemed a little bewildered to be there (maybe a last minute fill-in?), one is the position supervisor, and the third (who seemed in charge) was the HR rep. 

It was a standard interview, not really many technical, or skills based questions, mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you've dealt with a difficult person...

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through my universities job search database and received an email to schedule a interview within a week. I had a phone interview that was short and sweet and she then asked me to attend the second round interview a week later. I was offered the position at the second round interview. I love Make-A-Wish the environment is very laid back but they definitely get their work done. The people who work their have amazing hearts and I would love to work with the company after I graduate.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and Weaknesses?

title: Donor Care Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview  and spoke 1:1 with various members of the organization. lots of questions, but also lots of opportunity to talk to other people.
good experience overall. they are a nice group.
Interview Questions: describe a time when you had a difficult situation to deal with

title: Human Resources Generalizt Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Phoenix, AZ) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was very nice but the interview process was very long. First I had a phone interview that was about 30 minutes. The woman I talked to was very nice and mainly asked about my skills and knowledge. I was called about 1 week later for an in person interview. This interview consisted of 2 different interviews with 1-2 people. The first interview was with 1 woman who would've been my boss. She was nice and asked the usual interview questions then she brought in 2 other women who would be my coworkers which was a little more casual and relaxed. About 2 weeks later I called for a third round which was 5 interviews including the first 3 people I met with and even the local COO. The whole process took about 30 days and while it was average beyond that, be prepared to wait.
Interview Questions: Explaining my various experience and knowledge with detailed labor laws.

title: Events Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (New Brunswick, NJ) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: I started out as an intern with the foundation.  A few months after my internship was over, they contacted me to see if I would be interested in covering for an employee during maternity leave.  When I arrived for the interview, they asked if I would be interested in the Admin. Assistant position instead.  The rest is history!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Over all good experience. Though the posting and the first interview they did not say the internship would not paid.  The phone interview and in-person interview both only consisted of reviewing my resume.
Interview Questions: Let's review your resume job by job, education, etc.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Make-A-Wish Foundation of America (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: The manager has a list of all the questions, mostly behavioral questions . She was very nice. We had a great conversation.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself
